Therefore, it goes against the discriminating wisdom of the world.
Relying on this meaning,
It is called the obstruction of wisdom.
In the explanation of the reason,
It clearly shows this meaning.
Because the defiled mind can see, manifest, and falsely grasp objects,
It briefly mentions the evolving consciousness, the consciousness of appearances, and the wisdom consciousness.
Going against the nature of equality means
Going against the fundamental wisdom that is equal in subject and object.
This explains the meaning of the obstruction of afflictions.
Because all phenomena are always still and have no arising characteristics,
This brings up the Dharma nature that is deluded by ignorance.
Because ignorance is unaware and falsely goes against the Dharma,
This reveals the meaning of ignorance deluding the Dharma nature.
Therefore, it cannot attain... and so forth, up to knowing,
Clearly shows the meaning of going against worldly wisdom.
The above is the second extensive explanation of the meaning of the causes and conditions of arising and ceasing.
End of the first fascicle of the Commentary on the Treatise on the Awakening of Faith
